thread.title: Jose Mourinho defends St Etienne team selection despite injuries to Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Jose Mourinho defends St Etienne team selection despite injuries to Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick

organizations.name: manchester united win europa league tie share

text:
Sport Jose Mourinho defends St Etienne team selection despite injuries to Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick Both players limped off and look set to miss the EFL Cup final but Mourinho refused to take the blame Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mourinho reacts as Manchester United win Europa League tie Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho has defended his team selection for Manchester United's Europa League win over St Etienne. 
The Red Devils lost both Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick to injury, with the duo now major doubts for Sunday's EFL Cup final. 
Mourinho's men led 3-0 from the first leg at Old Trafford but the United boss named a strong side for the reverse encounter. 
And despite losing both players to injury, Mourinho defended his decision. Mkhitaryan gives United the lead (Photo: Getty Images) Manchester United's Henrikh Mkhitaryan goes off injured (Photo: REUTERS) Jose Mourinho looks on (Photo: Christopher Lee) 
"You can be injured leaving your house or in the garden, you never know when or why," he said. 
"It's the result of so many matches. You have the risk of it but at same time when someone is missing its an opportunity for another one. 
"They are important players for us and not having them for the final is complicated. When they are not playing it is an opportunity for us.
